elements.title: Assumption of the Virgin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Assumption of the Virgin (pictured) by Palma Vecchio depicts the legend of the Girdle of Thomas as part of the Assumption of Mary?

elements.title: beoutQ (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Saudi Arabian broadcaster beoutQ pirated and resold beIN Sports programmes during the Qatar diplomatic crisis?

elements.title: Corky Palmer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Corky Palmer coached the Southern Miss Golden Eagles to their only College World Series appearance in 2009?

elements.title: Nuffield Press (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that more than 1000 tons of paper were used every year printing car literature for the British Motor Corporation by the in-house Nuffield Press?

elements.title: Harley-Davidson Motorcycle Factory Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, before there was a Harley-Davidson Motorcycle Factory Building, William S. Harley and Arthur Davidson built motorcycles in a shed?

elements.title: Alexander Marble (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alexander Marble, an expert in diabetes, was described as one of "the giant trees among the diabetes sequoias"?

elements.title: Citizen Sleeper (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the developer of Citizen Sleeper was inspired by the feeling of people coming together and their own experiences as a non-binary person struggling to make ends meet through the gig economy?

elements.title: Milt Wilcox (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Milt Wilcox, winning pitcher of Game 3 of the 1984 World Series, credited "throwing bowling balls" with rescuing his Major League Baseball career?
